page.title: 13Billingham Art Gallery
page.content: The Art Gallery was built next to the Council Offices. The aim was to give the local population the chance to see visiting art Exhibitions.There are two galleries. The main gallery is 62 feet by 42 feet and the small one, 42 feet by 18 feet. This is only used for large exhibitions. The entrance to the gallery is up a white marble spiral staircase. There is space for up to 200 pictures. About 100 people visit the gallery every day. There are security cameras and no smoking or eating is allowed. It is quiet as people look at the pictures. Exhibitions are displayed for 6 or 7 weeks. Sometimes pottery is displayed in the centre of the gallery. Exhibitions are booked months in advance and are chosen by the Museum Curator of Stockton.
